intro: Dryandra calophylla, commonly known as the slender dryandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-red flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to the arid conditions of its native habitat. It is often found in open woodlands and heathlands, where it contributes to the biodiversity of the region. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
